descripcion: We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.The Team:As an Intern Business Analytics & Management Consulting you join our Value Engineering team to focus on driving and closing opportunities by identifying and selling the value Celonis can bring to customers. Our Value Engineers (VE) are the trusted advisor for customers and work on the intersection of technology and business. Value Engineers partner with sales and customers to create compelling solutions to critical business problems.The Role:Value Engineers are the trusted advisors for our prospects and customers that bring together Product, Technology and Process Know-how to solve our prospects' and customers' most pressing challenges You will gain experience in executing proof of value projects and take part in technical discussions with stakeholders. By creating customer-based business cases, you support the strategic business development activities for the Nordics market.Location:In Madrid engaging with the Nordics market.The work you‚Äôll do:Analyze data from our customers to increase transparency in business processesUnderstand the pain points of our customers and translate them into actionable use cases in the Celonis Process Intelligence PlatformQuantify financial impact of use cases implemented in the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform and prepare management ready presentationsPresent findings together with your team in front of customers‚Äô C-level and decision makersThe qualifications you need:Student in the field of Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program. Strong communication skills and interest in interacting with potential customersExperience in consulting and highly interested in Data AnalyticsKnowledge in SQL or related database query languagesAnalytical mindset and the ability to work in a structured manner and quickly comprehend new topicsAvailability as soon as possible for 6 months (full-time)Effective communicator and fluent in English and Finish, Swedish or Danish What Celonis Can Offer You:The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technologyInvestment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work withAn open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teamsBusiness Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our FutureAbout Us:Celonis helps some of the world‚Äôs largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.Equal Opportunity at Celonis:Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.Your Privacy:Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate NoticesPlease be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.

descripcion: Please note that this role is based in Saudi Arabia on a permanent, residential basis.Job Req ID: 15201Description: Aramco energizes the world economy.Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco‚Äôs value to society.Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations‚Äô spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom‚Äôs vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.OverviewWe are seeking a Senior Lifecycle Analysis Scientist to join our Technology Strategy & Planning Department (TS&PD).TS&PD provides critical and timely information and develop execution strategies to align Company projects with value driven deployments in high impact areas which offer the Company a significant, distinctive and sustainable competitive advantage in its core businesses. TS&PD also assures the intellectual property protection and management are coordinated with the ultimate objective of the technology strategy.Your primary role will be to develop energy systems models, conducting climate change impact assessments, and providing critical insights to inform our corporate decisions.Key ResponsibilitiesAs the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:Build energy systems models and conduct life cycle analysis (LCA) of various petroleum, natural gas, hydrogen, power and e-fuel supply chains/pathways.Participate in collaborative research with universities and research institutions for increased intellectual property opportunities and future business advancement of Aramco.Maintain existing and develop new engineering-based models, tools and simulation software (using Matlab, Python, VB Excel, R) for energy system modeling and data processing, analysis, interpretation, and visualization.Minimum RequirementsAs the successful candidate you will hold a bachelor‚Äôs degree. A PhD in Science, Engineering, Physics, or Mathematics is preferred.You will have a minimum of 7 years‚Äô experience in an industrial or technological environment relevant to the energy sector.You will be able to demonstrate a good understanding of LCA methodologies and environmental policies and regulations in major markets worldwide (e.g., E.U., China, U.S.) or specific legislative bodies (e.g., ICAO, IMO).Working environmentOur high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world‚Äôs biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs ‚Äì one of the largest in the world.Country/Region: SA

descripcion: ResponsibilitiesTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.Why Join UsCreation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.Join us.The LIVE Operations team is obsessed with everything to do with TikTok LIVE. From content strategy, monetization, gifting, LIVE features, data analysis, creating campaigns and ensuring a fun and safe space for all of our LIVE users.The LIVE Operations team is looking for an an enthusiastic LIVE Agency Operations Manager to build strategic, successful, long-term relationships with local based agencies.What You Will Be Doing Identify and establish potential cooperations with agencies, MCNs and organisations who focus on live-streaming Manage internal and cross-functional projects across the live-streaming agency ecosystem Support the creation of LIVE operations policies, contracts, education tools and terms for agencies while working with cross-functional teams globally Guide the existing agency portfolio across operational topics such as education, training and shared operational services Provide strategic guidance to agencies with regards to variety and quality of content verticalsWho are you? A kind team player with strong communication skills Results-driven with strong data analysis skills and comfortable in a high-growth environmentQualificationsMinimum Qualification: Bachelor's degree or above 4+ years experience related to, comparable to or relevant to the live-streaming or entertainment industry Fluent in Spanish and English to manage Spanish speaking creators Professional, patient and skillful communicator Result-oriented, good data analysis skills and capacity for pressurePreferred Qualification Existing network with influencers, celebrities or live-streaming platforms or an affinity for it Passion for the creator economy and its enormous potentialTikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Ideally in a Payments, Finance or Fraud Prevention.Strong SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.Knowledge of data visualization tools such as Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.Basic knowledge of programming languages like Python or R.Understanding of experimentation (A/B Testing, Multivariate Testing).Familiarity with event-based analytics tools like Mixpanel or Amplitude.Basic understanding of machine learning and data engineering concepts.Good communication and presentation skills and the ability to work independently and as part of a cross-functional team.üöÄ Extra points:Past experience working with data coming from Payments providers like Stripe or Checkout.Cloud computing working experience such as AWS Redshift, or Google Big Query.Basic knowledge of dbt, airflow, or other data pipeline tools.Experience with predictive modeling (MMM, Forecasting, NN). About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.As we continue our lightning-fast growth, 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleWe love data. We can‚Äôt get enough. It sits at the heart of everything Revolut does. From onboarding flows to product launches, we use it to inform and delight üòÅ We build things that we actually want to use ourselves, because if you don‚Äôt want it, the customer certainly won‚Äôt.We are looking for next-level Data Scientists to climb aboard the rocket ship and shape the future of financial services apps. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. TripleTen is a service that empowers individuals, regardless of their prior experience, to embark on the exciting and challenging journey of mastering IT professions such as software engineering, data analysis, data science, business intelligence analytics, and QA engineering in a feasible and accessible way, ultimately leading to employment opportunities. Our mission is to ensure that every student has the opportunity to successfully master a new profession and become a valuable member of the IT industry. As a Product Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving the growth of our product metrics and ensuring their sustained success. What you will do:Hypothesis Development: Generate and formulate hypotheses to improve key product metrics such as activation rate, compilation rate, attendance rate, and retention.Experimentation: Design, execute, and evaluate research and experiments, setting clear goals based on their potential impact on core metrics.Process Creation: Develop and implement processes from scratch to support growth initiatives.Project Ownership: Take full ownership of projects, from ideation to execution and results analysis.Stakeholder Interaction: Collaborate effectively with stakeholders, users, and cross-functional teams, including content, student experience, marketing, analytics, design, and development.Market Insights: Gather and leverage insights about the market and audience to inform strategies and initiatives.Requirements:3+ years of experience as a Product Manager, Product Marketing Manager, or Growth Manager.Proven success in designing and executing experiments that led to measurable improvements in product metrics.Ability to present the results of growth experiments clearly, with actionable recommendations.Skilled in working with cross-functional teams and influencing outcomes without formal authority.Language Proficiency: Upper-Intermediate or higher proficiency in English, both written and verbal.English proficiency at B2 level or higher.Spanish, Portuguese, Russian language skills would be a plus.Passion for education and awareness of the latest industry trends are highly valued.What we can offer you:Full-time collaboration with a flexible schedule that suits you.Convenient digital office with collaboration tools like Slack, Miro, Notion.Professional freedom, where we trust your experience instead of wasting each other's time and effort micromanaging.International team of professionals.

This role combines business analysis with data engineering, focused on bridging the gap between the US/Canada business unit and Enterprise Data Platform team. The successful candidate will work closely with stakeholders to identify data requirements, build data solutions, and ensure seamless integration into the Enterprise Data Platform (EDP) to meet the reporting and analytics needs of the US/Canada business. This role will encompass responsibilities across business analysis, business relationship management and data analysis.Essential FunctionsUnder general direction, formulates and defines systems scope and objectives based on both user needs and a good understanding of applicable business systems and requirements.Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering equipment capacity and limitations, operating time, and form of desired results.Includes analysis of business and user needs, documentation of requirements, and translation into proper system requirement specifications.Prioritize development items to ensure alignment with business goals.Work closely with US/Canada business unit to understand their data and reporting needs.Identify and prioritize additional data fields and elements required for more granular reporting and analytics.Analyze current data availability and identify gaps in data needed to meet business reporting and analytic requirements.Define and document the necessary transformations required to combine business unit data with enterprise-level data in the EDP.Assist in building and maintaining data pipelines to ingest data from various sources into the Enterprise Data Platform (EDP).Assist in the development of scalable processes to ensure efficient data flow and integration for the US/Canada business.Serve as the primary point of contact for the US/Canada business unit for all data and IT-related matters.Foster a strong relationship between the business and Enterprise System, acting as a strategic partner to align technology solutions with business needs.Facilitate regular communications between the business and EDP team to ensure ongoing collaboration and transparency.Attend daily stand-up calls with the development team to gain status updates and address team queries.QualificationsBachelor's Degree Computer Science, Data Science or Business Administration, or equivalent experienceMinimum of 3-5 years of experience in business analysis, data engineering, or business relationship management, preferably in the healthcare or life sciences industry.Knowledge of business-wide applications (e.g. third party software and internal operational applications, etc.) or IQVIA client facing applications and products.Demonstrated ability to understand client requirements as well as underlying infrastructure applications, systems and processes to enable execution of those skills.Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., SQL, Excel, Tableau) and familiarity with database management systems.Experience with data pipeline development and ETL processes.Strong understanding of business process modeling, requirements gathering, and project management methodologies.Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills.Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively and manage relationships with stakeholders.Demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.Thorough knowledge of IQVIA data and current systems a plusFamiliarity with Snowflake a plusIQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.comAt IQVIA, we believe that diversity, inclusion, and belonging empower our mission to accelerate innovation for a healthier world. We create a culture of belonging by valuing the perspectives of all talented employees worldwide and providing them with the opportunity to power smarter healthcare for everyone, everywhere. When our talented employees bring their authentic selves and their diverse experiences to work, they enable us to accomplish extraordinary things. Multifaceted thought processes spark innovation. Multi-talented collaboration harnesses innovation to deliver superior outcomes.

descripcion: Our OrganizationAtradius provides trade credit insurance, surety and collections services worldwide through a strategic presence in 50 countries. Atradius has access to credit information on 200 million companies worldwide. Its credit insurance, surety and collections products help protect companies throughout the world from payment risks associated with selling products and services on trade credit.Department DescriptionWithin Atradius ITS, the Channels team is in charge of all applications and programmes specific to the Atradius digital channels. These include customer and partner portals as well as direct B2B solutions and ERP integrations.The team manages these applications in a BizDevOps manner. They are in charge of designing, implementing and operating application solutions for demands specified by Product Owners in the central or decentralized business or functional units outside ITS.Job DescriptionThe squads falling under Digital Channels comprise different roles. Each squad has an IT Asset Owner, Product Owner, Business Analyst, Developer and Test Engineers. For one of the squads, we are now looking for a solid software developer in Test.We are looking for people who:Are challenged to work in a dynamic, international, and demanding environment. Collaborate with product owners, IT asset owners, developers and other stakeholders to understand requirements, acceptance criteria, and user stories. Adaptable - Flexible and able to easily adjust to changing priorities or requirements. Participate in Agile ceremonies (daily stand-ups, sprint planning, retrospectives, etc.). Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong communication and collaboration abilities. Attention to detail and a commitment to quality. Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Are eager, hard workers, proud to deliver professional quality results. Creative yet responsible ‚Äì problem solvers and enablers. Key ResponsibilitiesYou are the technical person to go to for the technical challenges of test automation frameworks developed based on JavaScript, TypeScript, Playwright, JMeter. You actively help the team to straighten the Quality mindset and raise the risks, issues and dependencies with the Quality Control Manager Help perform various kinds of automated testing: infrastructure, Unit, Functional, Integration, load and stress Assess and accept the delivered software and secure the quality Guard the quality of the software delivered by the team Have a driving role in increasing the automation of end-2-end chain tests, in a repetitive fashion Take responsibility for the quality of user stories in the backlog Make improvements to the automated testing process and analyzing results Liaising with other teams and areas of expertise (developers, peer testers, etc.) Ensure that the Software is not only functional but also performs optimally Required SkillsYou have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills as well as strong mathematical and statistical skills at least at the bachelor level in a discipline like Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Mathematical Finance, or Econometrics. Strong programming skills: minimum of 3 years of experience in hands-on test automation, with at least 2 years' experience of working in an Agile environment. Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts using tools like Playwright, Cypress, React Testing Library, Vitest, Jest. Design Rest API tests using Postman or similar Integrate automated tests into the CI/CD pipeline to support continuous testing using AzureDevOps or similar. Understand the test automation frameworks and best practices. Experience with Git. Bonus SkillsProven track of experience with containers and Elastic You are familiar with Load and Stress testing strategies, and you have proven experience of JMeter. Knowledge of SQL and relational databases for data validation Required QualificationsISTQB certification or equivalent. excellent communication skills in English are required for the position. What do we offer?A dynamic, international and challenging work environment Training and support to reach your full potential including the opportunity for continuous professional development Attractive terms and conditions, including competitive salary, pension package and a range of flexible benefits and rewards Challenging tasks with individual development and training opportunities Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation stands with the quality of our people and the ideas they have. Insights and innovative solutions for our customers are the result of an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. That is why diversity is extremely important to Atradius. To ensure that all colleagues within Atradius can develop their qualities, we promote an inclusive culture in which everyone feels involved and valued. We encourage and welcome everyone to apply to our positions.Do you have any questions about our offer?Estrella RAMIREZ, Human Resources, is available by e-mail at estrella.ramirez@atradius.com.I am Atradius! - Do you want to know who we are?Get to know Atradius colleagues in this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NnsgT04OpTU&t=4sAtradius is a global provider of credit insurance, bond and surety, collections and information services, with a strategic presence in over 50 countries. The products offered by Atradius protect companies around the world against the default risks associated with selling goods and services on credit. Atradius is a member of Grupo Catalana Occidente (GCO.MC), one of the largest insurers in Spain and one of the largest credit insurers in the world. You can find further information on our website: https://group.atradius.com701

At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions.Write the next chapter of your ABB story.This position reports toIS Consumer Journey & Personas ManagerYour role and responsibilitiesIn this role, you will have the opportunity to support the organization‚Äôs vision and strategic direction. Users/Consumers Research (qualitative and quantitative) Data Analysis and Interpretation User Interface & User Experience Design Digital Product Design & Development Product Management & Development Process Improvement & OptimizationQualifications For The Role Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Design or Social Science (Product Design, Communication Design, Service Design, Social Informatics, Psychology) Master‚Äôs Degree in any of the following disciplines: Human-Computer Interaction / Product Design / Communication Design / Service Design / Consumer Journey / UX Design 10+ years of relevant experience 10+ years of global experience in applying Business Analytics, Consumer Journeys, Product Design, Digital Design, Product Management, Digitalization, and Consumer Experience (CX) of digital solutions More about usWe value people from different backgrounds. Dematic has an immediate need for a Process Management, Demand and Capacity Planner within the Global Integrated Business Process (IBP) team. This is an exciting opportunity to influence global, regional and project function execution alignment via optimization of our integrated process plans to achieve business objectives. In this role, you will serve as a business partner with project execution functions, sales, solution development, finance, and human resources in collaboration with our data science and other planning IBP team members.What we offer:Career DevelopmentCompetitive Compensation and BenefitsPay TransparencyGlobal OpportunitiesLearn More Here: https://www.dematic.com/en-us/about/careers/what-we-offer/Tasks and Qualifications:This is What You Will do in This Role: Work with global sales leaders to assess incoming order intake demand, by solution type, identify and mitigate risks with associated skill needs and capacity, and detect areas of constraints or availability. Contribute to demand forecasts and operational capacity forecasts at multiple levels of aggregation/disaggregation for various time horizons as part of a planning function.Analyze historical sales, execution trends, and financial projections to provide accurate demand forecasts for both new opportunities and backlog projects.Research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop, and analyze statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results.Collaborate with sales, marketing, and finance to understand demand forecast drivers.Process project demands through the various tools and data sources to drive a more systematic approach.Contribute to the monthly Demand meeting and participate in the S&OP monthly process.Use and maintain the planning software as the primary forecasting system tool.Collaborate with data science and analytics engineers and operations team members to create advanced business intelligence reports that capture key data points and identify trends as well as inform leadership of key areas of opportunity and challenges. Work with manufacturing and procurement SIOP leadership to develop plans and solve inputs to supply issues. Prepare and present material to regional and global leadership teams and make recommendations based on gathered data and analysis.Work with leaders from various functions on capacities and forecasts, providing the best cost sourcing solution within the supply network.Initiate and facilitate cross-functional data reviews as necessary to capture critical attributes.Present results and recommended action to leadership for approval.Facilitate and validate forecast load to the ERP system.Communicate forecast execution to key stakeholders.Process ad-hoc and forecast modifications (scenarios) as needed.Create, review, and publish program reporting.Identify, define, and drive new process improvement opportunities.Work on multiple planning projects independently.Perform analysis of functional global, regional, business unit capacity and project backlog plus new business information and develop objective scenarios by which to meet or exceed project execution.Develop and understanding of the practices, methodologies, and requirements and serve as advisor to all group members.All other duties as assigned. What We are Looking For:Bachelor‚Äôs degree in relevant field (engineering, finance, business, supply chain).More than 3 years of experience related responsibilities and/or Business Intelligence.Strong leadership, communication, and networking skills.Strong technical skills with familiarity with Salesforce, SAP, and Business Intelligence/Reporting environments.Self-starter with persistent drive to meet short- and long-term goals.Works well in unstructured and evolving work environment.Demonstrated ability to lead and improve cross-functional business processes.Capability to analyze data to identify, articulate, and facilitate resolution of gaps.Ability to navigate matrix organization to drive results.Microsoft Office skills with advanced Excel and PowerPoint is required.Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.Agile technique knowledge/experience beneficial but not required.Demonstrate the ability to work under pressure and meet strict deadlinesDemonstrate the ability to learn within a growing and fast-paced environment.Analytical mindset and focus on continuous improvement.Experience with BI tools (Power BI and Qlikview preferred).Ability to travel ‚Äì internationally and domestically (approximately 10%).Dematic is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants. Dematic prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, religion or belief, age, sex, national or ethnic origin, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Job DescriptionThe Team You'll Be Part OfCome create the technology that helps the world act together.Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people‚Äôs lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia‚Äôs Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise. Functions & Responsibilities: The job consists of tracking and monitoring end-to-end the process of defining, planning, developing, testing and deploying SW functionalities defined to satisfy incoming demand requests from different users. About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.As we continue our lightning-fast growth, 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleThe Credit team at Revolut is anything but ordinary. They design, develop, and launch credit features across the globe. The team manages our products from day one to the end ‚Äî developing the back and front-end, the data science infrastructure, and then creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management, and portfolio management solutions. It's a big job, but our people are a credit to us all.We're looking for a Head of Trade Finance to drive the launch of the business within Revolut. As an accomplished professional with extensive experience in trade or supply chain finance, you'll bring your ambition to lead our new team and establish the unit from scratch.Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch.What You‚Äôll Be DoingSetting up the vision for the Trade Finance business from scratchCreating and owning the entire strategy, including where we operate, what areas we focus on, how we sell, how we stand out, etc.Attracting, hiring, motivating, and developing a Trade Finance teamDeveloping and implementing processes, procedures, and governance required to run the businessEstablishing reliable and reputable third-party partnershipsSetting up and running day-to-day operations of the business, being accountable for the financial performanceWhat You'll Need8+ years of experience in trade finance in a bank or financial institutionDeep knowledge of and relationships in the EU and UK mid-sized trade finance industryGreat interpersonal and deal-making skills to communicate effectively with stakeholdersA detail-oriented, analytical mindsetThe ability to lead a team and build partnerships with other functionsTo be comfortable with and enjoy taking ownershipA passion for building new processes and challenging the status quoBuilding a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.Join RavenPack:RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.What We're Looking For:A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.What's in it for you?You will work with the latest technologies.Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Who we areAt CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~700 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?About the roleWe are looking for a Junior Analytics Engineer, who will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. You will be working closely with both our Data Analysts/Scientists and Data Engineers in order to build strong data foundations and a best-in-class platform, and will be experienced in implementing and expanding modern data workflows. Projects you might work in include:Contributing to build out our data model using dbt (Data Build Tool) to increase the velocity of our Analytics Team creating new core data objects and data transformations to make it easier for our Data Analysts/Scientists to query, work and understand our data.Implementing a data quality validation process to ensure our data platform delivers accurate insights to our business stakeholders.Participating in the definition and development of our ETL/ELT workflows by partnering with our Data Engineering team.A typical dayPartner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand problems-to-be-solved with our current data platform, identify solutions, and deliver high-quality data foundations to data stakeholders across the business.Create and own efficient and scalable core data objects and transformations that unify key data assets and streamline analytical workflows.Evolve our data platform using a modern data engineering stack, including data warehousing, data workflow platforms, data validation products, and other necessary technologies.Work with cross-functional stakeholders (Product, Marketing, Operations, Finance) to curate, define, and document company-wide sources of (data) truth.What you need to succeed1 - 2 years of experience in data-related positions using data to drive product growth and operational efficiency.Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or similar. Good knowledge in SQL.Commitment to applying software engineering best practices in an analytics environment.Experience working in Agile environments with tools such as Jira or Asana.Excellent communication skills and ability to work with technical and non-technical partners from many teams, especially in exploring decisions and trade-offs.Deep interest in learning about and keeping up with quickly evolving industry trends around the modern data stack and data best practices.Advanced level of EnglishNice to HaveExperience with DBT (Data Build Tool)General knowledge of Python and GitGeneral knowledge of Jinja templating in PythonExperience with analytics and BI tools such as LookerExperience in data warehousing (Redshift, Snowflake)About the recruitment processYour first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your first tech Interview! You will meet two of ours colleague from our amazing Data Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your previous experience in data as well as your knowledge of SQL and our core technological environments.If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... time to move on to the second technical interview! In this new interview you will have the opportunity to demonstrate your expertise in a data challenge with one of our colleagues.If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.Why CoverWalletAt CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure‚Ä¶üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our hybrid-remote work model.üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionallyüõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)üçè Great office in Madrid, Valencia and Sevilla, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Business Area OverviewRISK is an integrated and independent control Function of the BNP Paribas Group. It is the second line of defence on the risk management activities of the Group which are under its direct responsibilities, including credit and counterparty risk, market risk, funding and liquidity risk, interest rate and foreign exchange risks in the banking book, insurance risk, operational risk and environmental and social risks.RISK aims at being a partner of the businesses by contributing to their sustainable development, but also a gatekeeper to ensure risks taken remain compatible with the Group‚Äôs Risk Appetite and its strategy. RISK teams engage in an upstream dialogue with businesses to better understand their strategy, objectives and then they express their opinions and recommendations.RISK Shoring Office is part of RISK Consulting & Transformation and is in charge of steering RISK development of activities in its international Hubs, in line with BNP Paribas and RISK ambitions.RISK Shoring Office mission is to provide advice on end-to-end processes for intragroup outsourcing activities, in line with the regulation and Group procedures, which involves a high visibility and direct contact with internal clients inside an international and dynamic environment.RISK Shoring Office is looking for people with passion for the Banking sector and the risks framework. People who will contribute to RISK growth, strategic transformation and processes/resources optimization.RISK Shoring Office reports and supports the Global RISK Hubs Coordinator in the RISK strategy design and in the development and deployment of operating models in the RISK Hubs worldwide.Key Responsibilities Of The Role Support RISK Shoring Office in its initiatives: Contribute to ensure the proper application of the intragroup outsourcing methodology, support the RISK teams in the production of documentation, and coordinate the collection of information and validation process with the Group Control Functions and key Perform administrative tasks: scheduling meetings, drafting minutes of the meetings, and other related administrative duties. Promote the RISK Consulting & Transformation internal life, especially by endorsing any of the internal initiatives or RISK Consulting workgroups.Experience, Qualifications And CompetenciesEducation: Current studying a master‚Äôs degree or equivalent.Full professional competence (minimum C1) in English (French would be a plus)Advance Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint. Advanced user of data analysis/visualisation tools (PowerBI) is also a plusAttention to detail and problem-solving skillsFlexible, client oriented, collaborative / TeamworkBenefitsHybrid telecommuting model. One vacation day per month worked (according to the duration of the agreement with the university).Meal allowance. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. DescriptionFinance teams are the strategy drivers to any organization. This role gives you the opportunity to see how we make business decisions as you gather insights to shape our future. Your missionYou will work on different projects to help Astrafy customers get the most out of their data. You will work on the business and technical sides of the customer use case.Design and maintain scalable data pipelines leveraging technologies such as Airflow, dbt, BigQuery, and Snowflake, ensuring efficient and reliable data ingestion, transformation, and delivery.Develop and optimize data infrastructure in the Google Cloud environment, implementing best practices for performance, cost, and security.Utilize Terraform and Kubernetes to automate infrastructure provisioning and manage containerized workloads, promoting agility and repeatability across environments.Implement robust data governance and quality measures, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and compliance throughout the data lifecycle.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and deploy Looker dashboards and other analytics solutions that empower stakeholders with actionable insights.Continuously refine data architecture to accommodate changing business needs, scaling solutions to handle increased data volume and complexity.Champion a culture of innovation by researching, evaluating, and recommending emerging data technologies and industry best practices.If you don't check every box, don't worry. experience with other cloud providers is a plus.Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Understanding of Terraform for automating infrastructure setup and management, plus exposure to container orchestration with Kubernetes.Analytics & Visualization: Experience with BI tools such as Looker, including designing and developing dashboards for data-driven insights.Data Governance & Security: Knowledge of best practices for data quality, lineage, and security, ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards.Team Player: Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively within cross-functional teams to deliver impactful data solutions.Continuous Learning: Curiosity to stay updated on emerging data technologies, practices, and frameworks, and to share knowledge across the organization.Strong data visualization skills to convey information and results clearlyYou speak English fluently, and a word of French and/or Spanish is a plusWas this list a bit much? ResponsibilitiesThis is a 6 month fixed term contract.About TikTokTikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join UsCreation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible.  Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day.  To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.  At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact-for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve.  Join us.The TikTok Community is the heart and soul of TikTok. The Content Operations team's mission is to facilitate the growth and development of Creators and Publishers to bring the best high quality content to TikTok, by increasing their engagement through content initiatives and product adoption programs. This team will also create scalable initiatives to build, celebrate, and recognize our diverse and inclusive communities around the world.Responsibilities- Participate in the implementation of strategies that contribute to the attraction, retention, and motivation of creators, publishers, agencies, and stakeholders to build long-term relationships that align with platform goals.- Execute & operationalise content and product programs to incentivise engagement, collaboration, and community building, including the use of editorial tools. - Act as the first point of contact for creator and talent agency inquiries. Resolve doubts, provide technical support, and channel specific questions to the appropriate teams when necessary.- Analyze performance metrics and programs/initiatives results to monitor objective completion and inform areas of improvement.- Identify and nurture emerging talent, ensuring a pipeline of diverse creators aligned with platform values and priorities. and goals.- Manage (directly or through an agency) all logistical aspects necessary to execute successful activations with creators.- Develop scalable communication materials, including newsletters and training sessions. Organize webinars, workshops, and events to enhance creativity and strengthen relationships with creators.- Assist in administrative tasks such as updating databases, managing contracts and payments, and ensuring payment timelines are met.QualificationsMinimum Qualifications- Experience: 2-5 years of experience in marketing, communication, or project management roles. - Experience working with creators is preferred. - Multitasking Skills: Ability to handle multiple tasks efficiently and meet deadlines in a dynamic environment. - Excellent Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to engage with creators from diverse backgrounds and cultures. - Strong Understanding of the Creator Ecosystem: In-depth knowledge of the creator ecosystem in the Spanish market, particularly on TikTok, and familiarity with current digital content trends. - Confident with data analysis and reporting. - Languages: Proficiency in Spanish and advanced English language skills.Preferred Qualifications- Adaptable: Thrives under tight deadlines and can manage uncertainty and shifting priorities effectively.Self-Starter: Proactive and able to work independently with minimal supervision.- Quick Learner: Fast at picking up new technologies, tools, and software.- Organized: Skilled at managing multiple projects and meeting deadlines efficiently.- Collaborative: Works well with diverse teams and communicates clearly across different stakeholders.- Detail-Oriented: Ensures accuracy and quality in all tasks.- Results-Focused: Delivers measurable outcomes and drives initiatives forward.- Passionate About Content: Has a strong interest in creators, content trends, and the TikTok platform.TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

titulo_oferta: Associate Data Science & Management Consultant (France) - Orbit Program
descripcion: We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.Location: Madrid, with the view to relocate to France after two years. Customer base will be in the France region, involving travel to meet clients in person.The TeamOur Value Engineers (VE) are the trusted advisor for customers and work on the intersection of technology and business. Value Engineers partner with sales and customers to create compelling solutions to critical business problems. A great VE understands the customer, the technology, and the sales cycle making it what may be the most interesting, challenging, and fulfilling role in enterprise technology sales.You will be joining the Global VE Center of Excellence which is an international, diverse, and dynamic organization at the core of the Celonis Value Engineering team. As a team, we enjoy working in a fast-paced environment and share a sense of belonging to a community that wants to learn and grow together. The team culture is one based on building trust, continuous development, and improvement through coaching & mentoring. You will be reporting to the Manager Value Engineering Graduate Program.The RoleTalented individuals launch their careers in the enterprise software world by joining the Orbit Graduate Program as an Associate Value Engineer.The 12-month program is a unique experience to fast start your Value Engineering career that highlights hands-on learning, mentorship, and a team culture where we rely on each other to learn, grow and achieve. The program is designed to develop essential VE skills & competencies and establish strong lasting relationships allowing you to grow your career at Celonis.Your journey will start with onboarding & enablement to develop your business and Celonis skills through a combination of hands-on experience in customer engagements and different pieces of training which cover amongst others the Celonis EMS, domain knowledge, presentation & demo skills, discovery & objection handling as well as value selling.The work you‚Äôll do:Work as part of the France Value Engineering team on customer engagementsCollaborate with customers to uncover their core business challenges and determine how Celonis EMS can help them achieve their business objectivesExecute proof projects showcasing the value of Celonis EMS in the context of our customers‚Äô strategy, business initiatives, and challengesCollaborate with customers and partners to design and build solutions in the Celonis EMS that drive value realisation and ensure a positive return on investmentFrame the strategic and quantitative business value Celonis will bring to our customers‚Äô organization and deliver presentations to senior executives that outline the opportunity, product solution, and business case to drive investment decisionsBuild strong relationships with our customers by winning their trust through technical, product expertise, and business acumen to act as a trusted advisor.Collaborate and share customer insights & feedback with internal Product and Engineering teams to influence product innovationCreate re-usable collateral, best practices & tools within the Global VE Center of Excellence and feed them back to the regional Value Engineering teamThe qualifications you need:We are looking for people who enjoy solving problems, think outside the box, and are not afraid to make and learn from mistakes. You have a bachelors and/or masters degree level in the field of Technology & Management, Industrial/Business Engineering, Business Informatics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics or a comparable degree program, as well as work/internship experience. You‚Äôre curious, self-motivated, enjoy continuous learning, and you want to work in a lively environment characterized by high growth.You are successful as a Value Engineer if you:Have a passion for technology & big data and the impact it can have on the worldHave a hunger to learn new technologies; knowledge or hands-on experience in SQL, Python is a plusAre able to think analytically and creatively, especially in applying technology solutions to core business problemsAre focused on creating and adding value for customersHave an entrepreneurial mindset and the ability to multi-task, prioritize and executeAre able to build relationships with senior management and influence decision-makersAre confident to present to C-level executives and larger audiencesAre an effective communicator and fluent in English and FrenchWhat Celonis Can Offer You:The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technologyInvestment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work withAn open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teamsBusiness Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our FutureAbout Us:Celonis helps some of the world‚Äôs largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It‚Äôs system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.Equal Opportunity at Celonis:Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.Your Privacy:Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis‚Äô Accessibility and Candidate NoticesPlease be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. titulo_oferta: Energy Insights Manager (m/f/d) for Vantage Towers - Europe-wide
descripcion: The opportunityThe position can be filled anywhere across the Vantage Towers markets.At Vantage Towers, we‚Äôre on a mission to power Europe‚Äôs sustainable digital transformation. As a leading tower company, we‚Äôre ushering in an era of technology-driven advances to help connect people, businesses, and internet-enabled devices like never before. We combine the scale, stability and quality of our tower network with the agility, optimism and energy of a start-up.As a young TowerCo, we have already achieved strong results with a continued focus on accelerating growth and a special emphasis put on sustainability. As part of our team, you‚Äôll work in a dynamic and multicultural environment that embraces open communication, collaboration and teamwork.If you‚Äôre ready to take responsibility and shape the future of telco infrastructure with us, then let‚Äôs level up in your career and reach the top ‚Äì together.Your ContributionYou are responsible for leading the deployment and ongoing compliance with ISO 50001 across local TowerCosPrepare, implement, and monitor internal and external audits for the certification and maintenance of the management systemDefine and report against technology KPIs, manage energy related training courses and drive employee engagementResponsibility for the continuous improvement of the ISO 50001 standardsLeading and managing the technology related ESG data and KPIs for internal and external reporting across local TowerCosProactively driving the global exchange between the local TowerCos in terms of energy management systemWhat Makes You Stand OutAt least 5 years of professional experience, at least 2 years of them in energy management in the energy services, telecommunications, property management or infrastructure sectorAn university degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or a comparable degreeExperience in managing ISO 50001 development, implementation, and monitoringExperience with data analytics and KPIs reportingStrong analytical, project management and stakeholder management skillsFluent English skills written and spoken (C1), German skills are an advantageWhat We OfferA diverse, multicultural setup based on our values ‚Äì respect, teamwork, responsibility and honesty ‚Äì and the unique opportunity to shape the organisation An attractive salary packageMaximum flexibility: With Full-Flex Office, you can freely decide how you‚Äôll work. Choose between the regular working schedule, part-time options (at least 30 hours) and work without fixed working time. You can even work from other EU countries for up to 20 days per yearFree home office equipment: In addition to a laptop and mobile phone, we provide a monitor, keyboard, mouse, headset and desk chairFull-Flex credit: discount on private internet costs and mobile productsA total of 30 days in holidays with the option of 10 additional days against salary waiverSupport during parental leave to have the best work-life balance possibleExtensive learning opportunities and individual support for your professional and personal developmentA subsidized company pension scheme, bike and car leasing, fitness and health offers, access to corporate benefits, international career opportunities, exchange possibilities, insurance for company conditions and many more ...Interested? Send us your CV with your desired salary. Depending on the role, we generally invite you to two rounds of interviews before you receive your offer.Not the right match? We have plenty of other opportunities to choose from in this department here .

Who You'll Work WithYou will have the opportunity to work in either the Madrid, Lisbon or Wroclaw office as part of our Capital Analytics Client Capabilities Network. This network is a component of our larger Capital Excellence Service Line.Capital Analytics provides distinctive analysis, insights, and support to major capital projects across sectors. We offer services including estimate and schedule validation, benchmarking, diligence, and readiness reviews. Our dedicated specialists apply proprietary tools and methodologies and a data-driven approach.Our aim is to embed deep capital analytics into all our engagements and help cement Capital Excellence service across industries.What You'll DoYou will work in teams as a specialist practitioner to solve pressing and complex issues at clients through deploying analytical tools, as well as support the development of new proprietary tools, benchmarking databases and market perspectives.In this role, you will often work in teams of typically 3-5 consultants, playing an active role in client engagements. This includes gathering and analyzing information, formulating and testing hypotheses and developing communication and recommendations. You‚Äôll also present results to client management and implement recommendations in collaboration with client team members.You‚Äôll also focus on building and scaling analytical solutions used for engagement across portfolio optimization, project development and value improvement, project execution, cost and schedule diagnostic. You will also prepare detailed cost estimates and budget forecasts for large-scale capital projects using advanced software tools and internal proprietary databases.You will contribute to McKinsey‚Äôs industry knowledge by staying up to date with the latest in the capital projects industry and you will contribute to proprietary models and analyses. This includes gathering the information necessary to develop these tools and synthesize your findings into McKinsey formatted products. These products may be in the form of complex models and summary reports which evolve into standalone presentations that outline key findings and recommendations to internal and external audiences.You will have the opportunity to gain new skills and build on the strengths you bring to the firm. You will receive exceptional training as well as frequent coaching and mentoring from colleagues on your teams.QualificationsBachelor's or advanced degree in engineering or construction science2+ years of experience on major capital projects for either an owner or contractor, ideally in a project management or project controls roleBackground in consulting, strategy and/or research is a plusModeling capability using Excel and experience managing large datasets with databasesDistinctive analytical and quantitative skillsProven record of leadership in a work setting and/or through extracurricular activitiesAbility to work collaboratively in a team environmentAbility to communicate complex ideas effectively - both verbally and in writingExperience with AspenTech estimator tool is a bonus

descripcion: Are you ready to revolutionize rural land? At¬†Orygen, we‚Äôre building cutting-edge AI technology to unlock the potential of rural lands. By harnessing the power of AI and data, we‚Äôre empowering rural communities, enhancing ecosystems, and driving meaningful environmental change. Join us in building a scalable solution that has the potential to reshape industries and improve our planet.¬†¬†

About RevolutPeople deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.As we continue our lightning-fast growth, 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.About The RoleThe credit department at Revolut is anything but ordinary. They design, develop, and launch credit features across the globe. The team manages our products from day one to the end ‚Äî developing the back and front-end, the data science infrastructure, and then creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management and portfolio management solutions. It's a big job, but our people are a credit to us all.As a Credit Manager, you'll be responsible for designing credit risk policies, procedures, and strategies for Revolut‚Äôs business (SME) lending products. This is a brand new feature in our portfolio. As the book grows, you'll be managing validation of the underwriting strategy, as well as leading the charge for preventative and reactive actions to the market and product offering.Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch.What You‚Äôll Be DoingDetermining the credit strategy for SME lending products in EUDeveloping account-level valuation frameworks to develop underwriting credit policies using NPV framework to optimise portfolio-level economic returnsOptimising credit strategies (new originations, existing customer management, arrears management) to maximise portfolio risk-adjusted returnsImproving credit decisioning capabilities, balancing them with a manual approachDesigning, deploying, and analysing champion-challenger tests across the credit lifecycleManaging credit limits, risk-based pricing, retention strategies, and over-limit policiesSupporting the annual budget, forecast, and planning processes, from assessing data to preparing a strategic planTracking, communicating, and drawing insights from performance of ongoing initiatives, staying on top of credit KPIs through intensive monitoringEnsuring approval and good rating of first line credit risk function from second line, third line, and regulatorsSelecting and onboarding new data suppliersWhat You'll NeedA proven track record of managing the risk cycle for SME credit products, like unsecured business loans, credit lines, etc.A bachelor's degree from a top university in an quantitative/analytical field, such as engineering, statistics, physics, math, economics, or managementA solid understanding of credit policy governance frameworks to work through second/third line of defence in a competent mannerTo deliver excellent results that exceed requirementsTo be forward-thinking to plan appropriately, meet multiple objectives, and proactively identify/resolve issuesA solid understanding of credit and behavioural scoring models for business lending products, especially in the SME segmentThe ability to explain complex concepts in a clear, simple mannerTo understand the value of speed to market and balance between elegant problem-solving and business needs of the hourNice to haveA master's degreeExcellent working knowledge of SQL, R, Python, and/or other data analysis toolsA willingness to learn new technology to help business scaleBuilding a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough.
