descripcion: Who We AreSolera is a global leader in data and software services that strives to transform every touchpoint of the vehicle lifecycle into a connected digital experience. In addition, we provide products and services to protect life‚Äôs other most important assets: our homes and digital identities. Today, Solera processes over 300 million digital transactions annually for approximately 235,000 partners and customers in more than 90 countries. Our 6,500 team members foster an uncommon, innovative culture and are dedicated to successfully bringing the future to bear today through cognitive answers, insights, algorithms and automation. For more information, please visit solera.com.  The RoleThis role is for a Lead SDET ‚Äì Software development Engineer in Test who leads the design, development, and delivery of automation test frameworks for our next generation software platform (computer vision, machine learning, sensor fusion, coaching workflows, reporting, alert management engines, high accuracy vehicle event analysis engines.) The successful candidate will provide technical automation leadership as part of the Software QA Team and is accountable for all aspects of the QA process.This position requires solid experience testing N-Tier application services and data platform within an Agile development environment. Also understands the database well.What You‚Äôll DoDesign, dev, docs, and maintenance of tools, test cases, and automation design for current and next gen software platforms Team with Product Management, SW Engineering, DevOps, and other technical teams in release planning and coordination Interpret functional requirements and designs to plan, develop, write, execute, and automate functional and data validation test plans Work with engineering and infrastructure teams on strategy and maintenance for required TDD/CI/CD development and Q/A environments Provide feedback and influence into the design process to help us build a testable platform, applications, and data models Design and build quality, performance, and reliability in from day one.Drive effective technical execution and communication as a member of Agile scrum teams Document and communicate module and automation framework functions, interfaces, performance criteria, test cases, and results to diverse audiences Estimate effort, schedule, and develop tasks according to agreed scope and development milestones to meet overall project timelines Conduct defect management activities to include problem identification, issue research, analysis, and documentation Work closely with the development team for unit-test reviews, issue diagnosis, resolution, and closure Lead or assist in data analysis to determine data health and consistency, or root cause of issues Lead the technical vision of the product assigned toTrain engineers on new tools, methodologies, and technologies.Mentor engineers and help foster their personal and professional growthIdentify areas of improvements and drive/implement solutions to drive efficiency and qualityIdentify technical solutions to problems and conduct POCs for new tools and applications What You‚Äôll Bring Must have:BS in Computer science or related field or 10 years of technical experience as an SDE/T or similar role 8+ years of applied professional experience in an object-oriented programming language Knowledge of and experience in full development lifecycle, including code standards/reviews, source control processes, building and testing. Experience developing and testing in C# or Java. Experience developing tests through Appium and Selenium libraries. Experience designing and implementing mobile applications for iOS and Android. Experience designing, implementing, maintaining, and scaling test automation frameworks with a focus on extensibility, scalability, maintainability, and high performance. Strong experience in developing and implementing End to End test strategies. Prior work experience in and understanding of Agile. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and ability to interact effectively across all levels. Ability to take a proactive, problem-solving/trouble-shooting approach to identifying and solving problems. Nice to have:Experience implementing software test automation into ci/cd process (Jenkins, Docker, Kubernettes, Linux OS). Experience with microservice architecture. Experience with Backend testing (API testing). Experience Jenkins or other CICD tools.

titulo_oferta: Clinical Trial Assistant- Sponsor Dedicated based in Madrid
descripcion: Clinical Trial Administrator, Single Sponsor dedicatedJob Overview:CTA performs daily administrative activities, in conjunction with the Clinical Research Associates and Regulatory and Start-Up teams, to ensure a complete and accurate Trial Master File delivery. By assisting in the coordination and administration of the study activities from the start up to execution and close out, and within the Local Study Team (LST) the Clinical Trial Assistant ensures quality and consistency of study deliverables to time, cost and quality objectives.Essential Functions:Assist Clinical Research Associates (CRAs) and Regulatory and Start-Up (RSU) team with accurately updating and maintaining clinical documents and systems like Trial Master File that track site compliance and performance within project timelines.Assist the clinical team with the preparation, handling, distribution, filing, and archiving of clinical documentation and reports according to the scope of work and standard operating procedures.Assist with periodic review of study files for completeness.Assist CRAs and RSU with preparation, handling and distribution of Clinical Trial Supplies and maintenance of tracking information. Coordinate the tracking and management of Case Report Forms (CRFs), queries and clinical data flow. Act as a central contact for the clinical team for designated project communications, correspondence and associated documentation.May collaborate with the clinical team on the preparation, handling, distribution, filing, and archiving of clinical documentation and reports according to the scope of work and standard operating procedures.Qualifications:High School or University DiplomaClinical research administrative support experience preferredComputer skills including working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPointWritten and verbal communication skills including good command of Spanish and English language.Effective time management and organizational skills.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with coworkers, managers, and clients.Basic knowledge of applicable clinical research regulatory requirement, i.e., Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and International Conference on Harmonization (ICH) guidelines as provided in company training.Knowledge of applicable protocol requirements as provided in company training.IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible ‚Äì to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

OverviewRole Title: Analyst Consultant - Sustainable TransportLocation: London, Harwell, Manchester, Glasgow, Shoreham, Madrid - Hybrid,Job ID: 2024-2646Ricardo plc is a global strategic, environmental, and engineering consulting company, listed on the London Stock Exchange. With over 100 years of engineering excellence and 3,000 employees in more than 20 countries, we provide exceptional levels of expertise in delivering leading-edge and innovative cross-sector sustainable solutions. Clean Energy and Environmental Solutions (CEES) , one of Ricardo plc‚Äôs operating unit s , offers leading sustainability consultancy services to customers around the world. We operate across the energy, transport, climate, chemical risk sectors, drawing on our decades of engineering, environmental and economic expertise . Are you passionate about sustainability, climate action, and driving change in transport? Do you want to work on high-profile projects for European institutions, national governments, multinational corporations and NGOs? If so, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!  We are looking for Analyst Consultants with a background in science, economics, or sustainability to join our vibrant Sustainable Transport team within our Policy, Strategy and Economics (PSE) practice. Why Choose Us? Make an Impact: Contribute to meaningful projects focused on sustainable transport. Your work will contribute to the development of transport and fuels policies and strategies with significant environmental and societal benefits, and influence industry and third sector decision-makers through state-of-the-art solutions and evidence.  Diverse, Collaborative Team: Be part of a fun, multinational team where you‚Äôll engage with global experts and experience different cultures during coffee breaks and team sessions.  Grow Your Career: Benefit from hands-on mentorship, learning opportunities, and exposure to a variety of exciting projects that align with your interests‚Äîsustainable transport, climate change mitigation, energy regulation, and more.  A Dynamic, Global Work Environment: From your first day, you‚Äôll join a supportive team, working closely with senior consultants on impactful international initiatives. The RoleAs An Analyst Consultant, You‚Äôll Support project delivery through data analysis, stakeholder engagement, literature reviews, and report writing.  Work on multiple exciting projects, managing your time and contributions effectively.  Collaborate with senior colleagues to provide actionable solutions for climate-focused policy, strategy, and economics challenges.  Gain valuable skills in research, economic analysis, and client-facing communication. What We‚Äôre Looking For An MSc degree (or near completion) in Science, Engineering, Economics, or related fields. A background in chemical engineering / chemistry / process engineering (with a focus on low carbon fuels), in transport/environmental economics or in mechanical engineering (with a focus on automotive industry) would be particularly desirable.  Strong analytical skills and the ability to synthesize data to support evidence-based solutions.  Excellent communication skills‚Äîboth written and verbal. You can simplify technical concepts for diverse audiences.  Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel and Word are key).  A collaborative mindset‚Äîyou‚Äôre a team player who thrives in diverse, multidisciplinary teams.  Fluency in English (Spanish required for roles in Madrid; other languages are a plus). What‚Äôs in It for You? Skill Development: Grow your expertise in data analysis, policy research, strategic advice and sustainability consultancy for the transport sector.  Hands-On Experience: Work alongside industry leaders, learning how impactful sustainability solutions are designed and implemented.  Global Opportunities: Collaborate on projects across Europe and beyond, tackling real-world challenges in sustainable transport.  Positive Impact: Be part of a consultancy that shapes policies and strategies for a more sustainable world.  Working here Ricardo offers an exciting and rewarding experience where you can make a real impact. You'll collaborate with talented, dedicated, and supportive teams, gaining hands-on experience across a wide range of projects. This is a fantastic opportunity to learn, grow, and develop your skills through mentoring and a personalized approach to your learning. We‚Äôre always eager to welcome individuals with drive, ambition, and a passion for innovative thinking. Wellbeing and work life balance We offer flexible approaches to work, whether that's working from home, being in the office, or a blend of both . We‚Äôre open to discussing flexible arrangements that suit your needs . Wellbeing is at the heart of our culture, helping you to thrive and make the most of your internship experience. We value our people, and we‚Äôre committed to supporting you through our wellbeing initiatives, including mental health first aiders, flexible working options, and access to support through our Employee Assistance Programme. Diversity, Equality and Inclusion statement We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person's potential, and we'll help you reach yours. We have an ambitious diversity, equality, and inclusion approach as explained here. We value diversity; recognising that a more diverse workforce creates a richer and more varied working environment. Diversity also drives innovation, by allowing us to offer our clients the best consultancy service that we can. As part of our commitment to engage positively and pro-actively with all our employees and ensure a culture of inclusivity, we are a recognised as a 'disability confident' employer. Next Steps Once you have submitted your application a member of our Recruitment Team will be in touch. Please be aware that the timing can vary dependent on the volume of applications that we receive for each role and in some cases, we may start to review applications prior to the closing date.

If you really want to make a difference in cybersecurity ‚Äì make it with us!Ready for an exciting challenge? We are looking for an experienced Cybersecurity Consultant who wants to revolutionize the market with his/her expertise and passion for security. At our company, we pride ourselves on having a strong expertise in factories and making it available to our customers. If you are ready to conquer the world of Cybersecurity and play a significant role in securing industrial processes, apply now!In a nutshell:As Industrial Consultant Cybersecurity you guide our customers into improving their cybersecurity posture in industrial and critical infrastructure environments. By positioning the global portfolio of Siemens in OT (Operational Technology) cybersecurity, we protect Siemens and our customers around the world. In your role as cybersecurity Consultant, you will face different stakeholder interests where you need to manage expectations by constantly translating technical concepts and expert topics into business language to assure management buy-in for accelerated progress in your projects.This is your challenge:You will be driving delivery of cybersecurity consulting services, e.g., gap and risk assessments, development of mitigation plans and tailored cybersecurity roadmaps.As part of a community of 1300+ cybersecurity experts you will collaborate and deliver comprehensive cybersecurity projects.Additionally, you will contribute to the development of the cybersecurity portfolio by providing input regarding customer demands, market trends, and evolutions of cybersecurity regulations.What we are looking for:A master‚Äôs degree in cybersecurity, computer science, data science or similar fields as well as first relevant work experience. Alternatively, you have an excellent bachelor‚Äôs degree in above majors combined with several years‚Äô relevant work experience in similar capacity.A first consulting experience from industrial environment is required, while solid cybersecurity knowledge is advantageous for this role.Ideally you are familiar with leading cybersecurity standards (e.g., IEC 62443, ISO 27001, NIST CSF).You possess knowledge of industrial control systems (ICS) / Operational Technology (OT).Knowledge of cybersecurity controls and technologies (e.g., hardening, IDS, vulnerability management, anomaly detection, network segmentation) is beneficial.Cybersecurity certifications (e.g, IEC 62443, CISSP, GICSP, CISA) are appreciated; willingness to learn and get certified along your growth journey is a prerequisite.You have outstanding analytical and communication skills and a high level of passion, social competence, and team spirit. Your willingness (around 10%) to travel to customer sites in Europe.You bring with excellent communication skills.What We Offer.Hybrid working concept in an international environmentDevelopment opportunities for both personal and professional growAn environment where everyone can bring their whole self to work and feel a sense of belongingBroal range of wellbeing offeringsShare matching program to become a shareholder of Siemens AGMake your mark in our exciting world at Siemens.Siemens is committed to equal opportunities for women and men, as well as diversity as a source of creativity and innovation. Having different types of talent and experiences makes us more competitive and better prepared to successfully respond to the demands of our society. We value candidates who reflect the Diversity we enjoy in our Company.

titulo_oferta: Principal Data & AI Architect - Field CDO EGM
descripcion: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.Job CategorySalesJob DetailsAbout SalesforceWe‚Äôre Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too ‚Äî driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good ‚Äì you‚Äôve come to the right place.Principal Data & AI Architect - Field CDO EGMJob DetailsAt Salesforce, we're seeking an outstanding individual to support the EMEA Growth Market (CEE/CIS, MEDITERRANEAN, ISRAEL, AFRICA) territory as Data & AI Architect - Field CDOSalesforce Agentforce and Data Cloud, our flagship innovations, harnesses the power of real-time data analytics and AI to redefine Customer 360, enabling scalable, high impact customer interactions.As a part of our Solution Engineering team, you will play a pivotal role in crafting customer engagement and delivering ground-breaking results! We are looking for individuals with deep Data and AI knowledge and strong experience in selling complex technology solutions, understanding cloud-based services, and designing B2B solutions. Collaborating with potential clients, you will dive deep into understanding their needs and challenges ultimately showcasing how Agentforce, Data Cloud are the answers for their most critical business goals.The Data & AI Architect / Field CDO is a customer-facing enterprise-wide authority with broad and deep awareness around the data, analytics and AI domains, paired with a good eye for business and partner engagement skills.The Data & AI Architect / Field CDO is an authority in categories that may include business strategy, AI, data, analytics, cloud and enterprise architecture. Field CDOs are encouraged to have strong sales and technical skills and use validated consultative approaches to engage with customers and motivate them for their transformation journey, along with defining the steps to get there.This role will have a strong customer-facing element with an emphasis on establishing strong partnerships with our most strategic customers and helping them implement a data analytics strategy that drives values for everyone.Responsibilities:Promote the value of Data & AI and the impact a data-led transformation can have on our customers‚Äô business and their customers‚Äô experience.Contribute to the customer's business planning and strategy by focusing on business capabilities and maturity. Understand customer needs, company's products/services and match them with outstanding technology to define a north-star target state. Help to define prioritization and sequencing of the transformation by proposing a strategic roadmap that leads to the target state. Lead key discussions about change programs.Resolve Salesforce (primarily focus on Agentforce and Data Cloud) and third-party technologies to leverage in the customer's architecture landscape, based upon product knowledge, industry experience and frameworks.Clearly articulate business architecture (mission/vision, capability models, capability assessments) and technical architecture (current and future state diagrams, solution standard processes, reference architectures, design patterns) to an executive audience.Share reliable and trusted -data rich- points of view of relatable customer transformations in the industry i.e. how other customers with similar needs have succeeded in their transformation.Help build our business through effectively engaging with account executives and solution engineers to develop opportunities for customer-facing enterprise analytics engagements.Participate in all appropriate product/sales training, certifications, educational sessions and industry summits to acquire and maintain the knowledge necessary to be effective in the position.Share engagement experience with the internal audiences and enrich collective IP. Conduct enablement sessions to mentor and guide other architects and solution engineers.Required Experiences And Qualifications:Proven success in either Data, AI, Enterprise Architecture fields over a period of 8+ years.Experience in delivering Data & AI solutions based on data-led transformations that demonstrate value and tackle meaningful business challenges.Deep understanding of Data Architecture, Data Governance and Analytics topics.Deep understanding of AI and machine learning concepts, understanding of the agent platform, how to configure and set up agents, hook them into existing flows, automation, api connection, etc.Strong technical selling skills including the ability to explain Data Architecture, AI models and solutions to non-technical clients and how Data + AI capabilities and solutions can translate to business.Deep appreciation of the CDO role and ability to nurture influential relationships with C-level executives.Credible knowledge around common enterprise architect topics such as persona based journeys, process orchestration, master data management, analytics and insights etc.Keen appreciation of Enterprise and Cloud Architecture and the principles of modern platforms including SaaS, PaaS, multi-tenancy, multi-tiered infrastructure, networking, security principles, etc.Proven grasp of Salesforce platform capabilities, or similar data and analytics platforms.Outstanding Communication And Negotiation Skills Honed Through Your Experience.A Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience with extensive background in technology sales.Fluency in English.Ability to travel up to 40‚Äì50%, as required to meet business needs.Advantageous/Preferred Experiences And Qualifications:Chief Data Office or Chief Data Scientist experience.Proven ability to craft and communicate data and AI strategies that align with business objectives.Deep knowledge on Salesforce Data, AI and Analytics technologies.Knowledge of analytics platforms like AWS S3, DataBricks, Google Big Query, Snowflake Microsoft Fabric.Knowledge of AI/Generative-AI solutions from vendors like AWS, Google, Microsoft.Proficiency in cloud platforms (e.g., Salesforce, AWS, GCP, Azure) and advanced data modeling techniques.A deep understanding of data security, compliance, and privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).About SalesforceWe‚Äôre Salesforce, the Customer Company, inspiring the future of business with AI+ Data +CRM. Leading with our core values, we help companies across every industry blaze new trails and connect with customers in a whole new way. And, we empower you to be a Trailblazer, too ‚Äî driving your performance and career growth, charting new paths, and improving the state of the world. If you believe in business as the greatest platform for change and in companies doing well and doing good ‚Äì you‚Äôve come to the right place.AccommodationsIf you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.Posting StatementAt Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. titulo_oferta: NHT/CCR Process Optimization Engineer - Relocate to Saudi Arabia, Permanent Expat Family Relocation Package
descripcion: Please note that this role is based in Saudi Arabia on a permanent, residential basis.Job Req ID:15348Aramco energizes the world economy.Aramco occupies a unique position in the global energy industry. We are the world's largest producer of hydrocarbons (oil and gas), with the lowest upstream carbon intensity of any major producer.With our significant investment in technology and infrastructure, we strive to maximize the value of the energy we produce for the world along with a commitment to enhance Aramco‚Äôs value to society.Headquartered in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and with offices around the world, we combine market discipline with a generations‚Äô spanning view of the future, born of our nine decades experience as responsible stewards of the Kingdom‚Äôs vast hydrocarbon resources. This responsibility has driven us to deliver significant societal and economic benefits to not just the Kingdom, but also to a vast number of communities, economies, and countries that rely on the vital and reliable energy that we supply.We are one of the most profitable companies in the world, as well as amongst the top five global companies by market capitalization.OverviewWe‚Äôre seeking NHT/CCR Process Optimization Engineer to join our Global Manufacturing Excellence (GME) organization under the Downstream Operation Engineering Solutions Department (OESD) and drive performance improvements for our facilities.OESD‚Äôs technical team is a multidisciplinary team that provides the necessary high-quality technical support to GM operating facilities (refineries, Natural Gas Liquids facilities, and petrochemical plants) within the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia and across the globe.You will identify optimization opportunities, develop data-driven recommendations, and guide facilities toward maximum impact.Key ResponsibilitiesAs the successful candidate you will be required to perform the following:Conduct comprehensive technical assessments of facilities‚Äô NHT and CCR units, focusing on identifying areas for optimization in yield, efficiency, and product quality.Translate insights into actionable recommendations, supported by detailed cost-benefit analyses and clear implementation roadmaps.Collaborate closely with facilities‚Äô process engineering teams, providing technical guidance for troubleshooting, problem-solving, and continuous optimization.Lead technical benchmarking initiatives, comparing facilities‚Äô performance against industry best practices to identify improvement gaps and provide recommendations.Develop and deliver targeted technical training programs on NHT/CCR technologies, best practices, and optimization strategies.Guide facilities in selecting and implementing advanced process simulation tools and optimization techniques specific to NHT and CCR units.Provide expert technical advice on catalyst management strategies, including performance monitoring, selection, and replacement, based on hands-on experience.Stay up-to-date with the latest technical advancements, best practices, and technologies in NHT/CCR process optimization, sharing this knowledge with facilities to enhance their operations.Minimum RequirementsAs the successful candidate you will hold a:Bachelor's degree in Chemical Engineering, preferably Master's degree or Ph.D. in Chemical Engineering or a related field, with a focus on process optimization.15 years of experience in process engineering, with at least 10 years of hands-on technical experience in NHT and CCR optimization within a refinery environment, and at least 5 years in a technical role focused on process improvement.Professional Engineering (PE) license is preferred.You will be able to demonstrate strong technical background in process engineering fundamentals, including reaction kinetics, thermodynamics, and mass and energy balances, as applied to NHT and CCR units.Proficiency in leading process simulation software (e.g., Aspen HYSYS, PRO/II) and their application in NHT and CCR process modeling and optimization.You will have demonstrated technical experience in successfully applying process optimization techniques, statistical data analysis, and advanced process control (APC) to drive measurable improvements in NHT and CCR units.You will have experience with real-time optimization (RTO) techniques specifically applied to NHT and CCR units.You will have in-depth technical knowledge of catalyst management and performance optimization strategies, gained through hands-on experience in NHT and CCR units.Familiarity with Industry 4.0 technologies, such as IoT, machine learning, and data analytics, and their application in optimizing NHT and CCR processes.Working environmentOur high-performing employees are drawn by the challenging and rewarding professional, technical and industrial opportunities we offer, and are remunerated accordingly.At Aramco, our people work on truly world-scale projects, supported by investment in capital and technology that is second to none. And because, as a global energy company, we are faced with addressing some of the world‚Äôs biggest technical, logistical and environmental challenges, we invest heavily in talent development.We have a proud history of educating and training our workforce over many decades. Employees at all levels are encouraged to improve their sector-specific knowledge and competencies through our workforce development programs ‚Äì one of the largest in the world.

AVEVA is a global leader in industrial software. Our cutting-edge solutions are used by thousands of enterprises to deliver the essentials of life ‚Äì such as energy, infrastructure, chemicals and minerals ‚Äì safely, efficiently and more sustainably.We‚Äôre the first software business in the world to have our sustainability targets validated by the SBTi, and we‚Äôve been recognized for the transparency and ambition of our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion. We‚Äôve also recently been named as one of the world‚Äôs most innovative companies.If you‚Äôre a curious and collaborative person who wants to make a big impact through technology, then we want to hear from you! Find out more at AVEVA Careers.For more information about our privacy policy and how to manage cookies, visit our Privacy Policy.The jobWe are looking for a Data Scientist to play a pivotal role in solving complex business problems and discovering business insights using quantitative disciplines (statistical, algorithmic, and mining) and visualization techniques. The role involves planning, executing, and delivering machine learning-based projects, contributing to building and developing the organization‚Äôs data science models, and supporting the organization with insights and analysis for decision-making processes.ResponsibilitiesUse advanced data science techniques and approaches to solve specific business problems, exploring a variety of techniques to identify the optimal solution.Prioritize, scope, and manage data science projects and the corresponding key performance indicators (KPIs) for success.Identify AI/ML business opportunities and collaborate across the business to understand IT and business constraints.Build predictive models, Machine Learning algorithms and experiments by writing optimized code and using state-of-the art ML technologies.Integrate domain knowledge into the ML solution, such as understanding financial risk, customer journey, quality prediction, sales, and marketing.Collaborate with ML operations (MLOps), data engineers, and IT to evaluate and implement ML deployment options.Bring new technology and approaches into production.Adhere to and promote to best practices and standards for data science process (including documentation) and code developments.Use data analysis, visualization, storytelling, and data technologies to scope, define and deliver AI-based and ML data science products.Evangelize and discover opportunities for the use of large language models (LLMs) within the organization.Remain up to date with industry practices and emerging technologies such as generative AI and test creative ways of offering AI solutions.Support the organization with insights and analysis for decision-making processes.Skills and qualifications:1-3 years of demonstrated experience in data science or related field.Solid mastery of programming fundamentals, algorithms and data structures.Expertise with core data science languages (predominantly with Python) and experience working with database systems (such as SQL, NoSQL).Demonstrated application of Data Science techniques in supervised and unsupervised learning contexts.Technical understanding of the key algorithms such as Linear Regressions, Random Forests, SVM, KNN, K-means, etc.Proven experience in developing and deploying Machine Learning (ML) models with measurable business impact.Past involvement in AI-based projects, especially with experience in advanced prompt engineering and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).Familiarity with Azure infrastructure, particularly Azure ML Studio and Azure Databricks.Knowledge of Azure‚Äôs Prompt Flow as a developmental tool is a plus.Knowledge of git/version control systems.Experience with search engines, classification algorithms or recommendation systems is a plus.Strong communication skills in English, both written and verbal.IT at AVEVAOur global team of 300+ IT professionals is responsible for the systems and platforms that keep AVEVA running. By empowering our colleagues and ensuring the smooth operation of the company, we help keep the business healthy and productivity high. We also provide key support for the transformation and modernisation efforts globally.We pride ourselves on a collaborative, inclusive and authentic culture that provides a framework allowing for autonomy, whilst always being available for support and guidance. We respect the differences that each team member brings and seek to include those perspectives in our solutions for our business functions. The energy and sense of purpose is evident when talking to team members, you will feel part of something special from the first day you join.AVEVA requires all successful applicants to undergo and pass a comprehensive background check before they start employment. Background checks will be conducted in accordance with local laws and may, subject to those laws, include proof of educational attainment, employment history verification, proof of work authorization, criminal records, identity verification, credit check. Certain positions dealing with sensitive and/or third party personal data may involve additional background check criteria.AVEVA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to being an exemplary employer with an inclusive culture, developing a workplace environment where all our employees are treated with dignity and respect. We value diversity and the expertise that people from different backgrounds bring to our business.Come and join AVEVA to create the transformative technology that enables our customers to engineer a better world.

adopting coding best practicesWorking closely with other data scientists and machine learning engineers to support the analytical part of the machine learning lifecycleYour StoryBackground in a DEIMOS is looking for an engineer to join the Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision (AICV) Competence Centre of the Avionics Business Unit, within the Flight Systems Directorate.This role focuses on supporting Deimos‚Äô AICV flight systems team in researching, developing, deploying, and scaling our Machine Learning and Computer Vision portfolio for onboard processing applications in Space. practical industry experience deploying and maintaining ML systems in production would be viewed very positively.Technical Requirements:Required:Strong foundation in machine learning algorithms, statistics, and data structures within relevant technical projects.Proficiency in programming languages and frameworks such as Python, C++, MATLAB, OpenCV, TensorFlow, Pytorch, scikit-image, and dlib.Experience with data preprocessing, feature engineering, and model evaluation techniques.Knowledge of software development life cycle and agile methodologies.A basic understanding of Machine Learning.Highly Desirable:Understanding of Computer Vision techniques.Experience working on aerospace-related projects.Experience deploying MLOps solutions and working within CI/CD frameworksExperience with Linux systems and cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, etc.)Experience developing embedded ML applications (C++, CUDA, TensorRT)Language Skills:Good level of English, spoken and written.Ability to speak Spanish, Portuguese, Italian, or Romanian will be considered an assetAbility to speak any other language will also be considered a positivePersonal Skills:Capability to integrate in and work within a trans-European teamSolid organisational, analytical and reporting skillsAutonomy and willingness to take initiativeExcellent communication skillsEnergetic, positive team player mentalityDon‚Äôt miss this opportunity! If you meet the requirements and are ready to take on new challenges, apply now with the English version of your resume and become part of our team at Deimos.Ref.: HRRECRUIT-1003

About MoonPay üåñüí∏Hi, we‚Äôre MoonPay. We‚Äôre here to onboard the world to Web3.Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratizing technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.What we doWe‚Äôre the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 20 million people around the world now trust our products ‚Äî just take a look on Trustpilot.We‚Äôre also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.But that‚Äôs not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. It‚Äôs taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.So whatever your background, we‚Äôre sure there‚Äôs something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.Locations Supported üåçPortugal, Spain, Poland, Romania, South Africa, UKAbout The Opportunity ‚úçÔ∏èWe're on the lookout for a skilled Product Data Scientist to join our team, where you'll be pivotal in driving business growth and maximising our product performance. NTT DATA is the 6th largest IT services company globally, with over 100,000 professionals and a revenue exceeding 15 billion euros. We focus on exceeding client expectations, managing projects proactively, and fostering growth through quality and talent. Our ambitious goal is to secure a position among the top 3 IT service providers worldwide, and for 4 consecutive years, we‚Äôve been recognized as one of the best places to work in Spain.We are expanding our Area of Expertise in Artificial Intelligence (AoEIA) and seeking a Generative AI Engineer with a specialization in Large Language Models (LLMs) to work on exciting projects for top-tier clients across Europe.What Are We Looking For?We are seeking a Generative AI Engineer to drive the technical design, integration, and deployment of LLM-based solutions. challenges.Your expertise will focus on:Designing and implementing SLM/LLM models (such as GPT, Gemini, or Llama) for various applications, including natural language understanding, text generation, summarization, and more.Building and integrating LLM-based platforms that deliver AI services in cloud-native, hybrid, or on-prem environments, tailored to client needs.Developing CI/CD pipelines specifically for LLM deployment and monitoring, ensuring continuous improvement and scalability of AI systems.Collaborating with data scientists and engineers to create flexible and robust LLM use cases for diverse industries, including customer support automation, knowledge management, content generation, and more.Overcoming challenges related to scaling LLM models, optimizing performance for inference, and ensuring efficient resource utilization in production environments.Establishing best practices for managing SLM/LLM fine-tuning and customization, ensuring high-quality model outputs that align with business objectives.What Will You Be Accountable For?As a Generative AI Engineer focusing on LLMs, your key responsibilities will include:Project Execution: Ensuring successful delivery of LLM-based solutions, developing the necesary pieces of code.Platform Development: Automating LLM platform management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) and deploying LLMs in large-scale environments.CI/CD and MLOps Integration: Developing pipelines for LLMs that streamline the lifecycle from training and fine-tuning to deployment and performance monitoring.LLM Customization: Building custom solutions to integrate LLMs with external systems, leveraging APIs, middleware, and bespoke development to meet client requirements.Innovation: Staying at the forefront of generative AI technologies, particularly LLM advancements, and bringing cutting-edge solutions to our clients.Why Would We Want to Meet You?We‚Äôd love to meet you if:You have 2+ years of experience working with AI projects, specifically involving large language models (GPT, BERT, etc.).You have hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).You are proficient in CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab, GitHub Actions) and have built pipelines that support AI/ML workflows, especially for LLMs.You have strong programming skills in languages like Python, with a focus on using machine learning frameworks like Transformers, PyTorch, or TensorFlow.You have experience deploying LLM models in production, ensuring they meet the specific needs of client use cases.You have worked on AI-driven projects in a startup, large enterprise, or research environment and have experience operationalizing LLMs for real-world applications.We Value Experience In:Developing LLM use cases, such as conversational agents, document summarization, content generation, and more.Implementing MLOps pipelines specifically for the LLM lifecycle, including data preprocessing, inference, and monitoring.Optimizing large models for efficient inference in production environments.Experience with model monitoring, retrieval strategies, and feedback loops to continuously improve model performance.What Do We Offer?At NTT DATA, we offer:The opportunity to work on high-priority LLM projects for leading companies in Spain and Europe.Direct visibility to senior leadership and involvement in transformative AI initiatives.The chance to apply the latest innovations in large language models and generative AI on platforms like AWS.The opportunity to attend and present at AI conferences.A competitive salary aligned with your experience.A personalized career development path with continuous learning opportunities, including certifications and training in AI, cloud technologies, and leadership.Interested?If you‚Äôre ready to shape the future of generative AI with us, apply today!
